citation.article-title: Hydrogenimonas thermophila gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel thermophilic, hydrogen-oxidizing chemolithoautotroph within the epsilon-Proteobacteria, isolated from a black smoker in a Central Indian Ridge hydrothermal field.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Hydrogenimonas (Hy.dro.ge.ni.mo′nas. N.L. neut. n. hydrogenium hydrogen; Gr. n. monas a unit, monad; N.L. fem. n. Hydrogenimonas hydrogen monad).
Short rods, highly motile via a polar flagellum.
Able to utilize molecular hydrogen as an electron acceptor and molecular oxygen, nitrate or elemental sulfur as electron acceptors.
Relatively high concentrations of calcium stimulate growth.
The G+C content of the genomic DNA is about 35 mol%.
Major cellular fatty acids are C16 : 0, C16 : 1 and C18 : 1.

On the basis of 16S rRNA gene analysis, the genus Hydrogenimonas is distantly related to any previously described genera within the ε-Proteobacteria, representing a potential new family level of taxon.
Members of the genus occur in global, deep-sea, hydrothermal systems.
The type species is Hydrogenimonas thermophila.
